document.title: Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

6F6B15997BC940FC846B96D9463B2003.description:
Anticipate and predict how
fire management techniques will evolve in the
future.Â

5F912118E0994147A3CE95985B955A4C.description:
Assess the effectiveness of
techniques previously and currently used to
prevent harmful fires

21336A139FE1473AB3E65CCDE9A4B6AC.description:
Research and summarize
how fire management techniques have
evolved.

6C5C021BE5FA401D83DF149054E7BA59.description:
Develop a prevention plan
for harmful fires for a particular region.

D8A98A9A8D204D738B731657D35F16F8.description:
Assess and apply techniques
used to fight wildfires, manage prescribed
fires and ensure human safety.

0016BCB6C0F34E068FA04986B20E8642.description:
Differentiate between desirable
and undesirable fires and research the
role fire plays in a healthy ecosystem.

B5CDE9B1705347A0BDD64723107AD5F9.description: Manage fires in natural resource systems.

E736140D762342A68D5F5314714AE665.description:
Identify potentially invasive
species and devise strategies to prevent
ecological damage that would result from the
introduction of that species.

88B24B16CDF847869A6BDA797DEC14CB.description:
Assess and implement a
plan for preventing the spread of harmful
species for its effectiveness.

3106339D88A34000A19558F46C24110B.description:
Research and summarize
strategies and benefits of preventing the
introduction of harmful species to a particular
region.

EE43CDD52B5B4433B88CEE1EFB36396C.description:
Create a management plan
to reduce spread of harmful invasive species
in natural resource systems.

C008B85773E34D708243B5AE45F5C3D5.description:
Analyze signs of the spread
of invasive species, identify if it needs to be
reported to authorities and determine which
authorities it should be reported to.

BA122C5ED5B64E72A6947C270FE9AACF.description:
Identify and classify invasive
species common to a particular region.

D630276EAF1C474AB5C10E5674E2D47F.description:
Create a management plan
to reduce spread of harmful insects in natural
resource systems.

99CB922F56A344248B5F34A0FE1677D2.description:
Analyze signs of insect infestation,
identify if it needs to be reported to
authorities and determine which authorities it
should be reported to.

E9C0D14529A7467DBA21832C263224EF.description:
Categorize harmful and
beneficial insects, as well as signs of insect
damage to natural resources.

9C44A15F72BF4FDD967BD114E168A2C1.description:
Prevent or manage introduction of ecologically harmful species in a particular
region.

242CEFB47D3749D78594F5D0AAA5E4C5.description:
Create a management plan
to reduce infection and spread of wildlife or
aquatic species diseases in natural resource
systems.

EF0441DFD4FE4FC49F41B536CB8DE08F.description:
Analyze a wildlife or aquatic
species disease based on its symptoms,
identify if the disease needs to be reported to
authorities and determine which authorities it
should be reported to.

2F652FF6FE134675A1935755B079B940.description:
Classify causes of diseases
in wildlife and aquatic species and determine
the correct authorities to whom some diseases
should be reported.

3D60FE9D043A489D842D4DAA7B2EDD2D.description:
Create a management plan
to reduce infection and the spread of plant
diseases in natural resource systems.

E0E68D5C696E496FAC17B2944F659697.description:
Analyze a plant disease
based on its symptoms, identify if the disease
needs to be reported to authorities and
determine which authorities it should be
reported to.

FBDE85DC1DF1435095566CBDBC3BE54D.description:
Classify causes of diseases
in plants and the correct authorities to whom
some diseases should be reported.

C4D884C31F8C435B935720A6158423FB.description: Diagnose plant and wildlife diseases and follow protocols to prevent their spread.

1C486B693A0747A681039E932994800D.description:
Create an improvement plan
for marine or coastal natural resources.

F2BDE935818142119394A6A5BD6D8E2B.description:
Assess and apply methods
to improve marine and coastal natural resources.

D2CF2C53CD1B4FB08C75FC718E221592.description:
Identify and categorize
characteristics of healthy marine and coastal
natural resources.

BED30429BAE44C06AB6A919D7A9865C0.description:
Evaluate the impact of recreational
activities on natural resources and
create an improvement plan.

FE4A2A26661545A090D2800E850ECCE3.description:
Assess and apply management
techniques for improving outdoor
recreation opportunities.

61251D17CC3740C8A899601737263127.description:
Identify and categorize
characteristics of natural resources that make
them desirable for recreational purposes.

6A68540A8F894B528461F3A3787E8561.description:
Evaluate and revise a rangeland
management plan.

32EB562EBFF74DD586187700978E6A63.description:
Assess and apply methods
of rangeland improvement.

BD6D2D503F854C23B169B46DA10EDAA3.description:
Identify and categorize characteristics
of healthy rangeland.

1B15C728FEAB473B9C6010D66A778DD3.description:
Devise a comprehensive improvement
plan for a wildlife habitat.

0ADE11F490394A4C9ED957811DB057B7.description:
Assess and apply methods
of wildlife habitat improvement.

BFD7777CDEEC4A199D597F62CBCAD07C.description:
Identify and categorize characteristics
of a healthy wildlife habitat.

73A2903A187241289D3B447F0ECA70E5.description:
Create a timber stand improvement
plan for a forest.

0696745B4A79429EB1B0B70526367CC5.description:
Assess and apply the methods
used to improve a forest stand.

B800C228B48B4BF1A0275FF545E568E7.description:
Identify and categorize characteristics
of a healthy forest

15DA1F7B80F84D75BAD00CDCE322EE59.description:
Create an enhancement plan
for a stream.

D99F311991F6482B8A74C891859C19F7.description:
Assess and explain indicators
of the biological health of a stream.

6E8DA09A7B00429B9AC3F96CEE0BBF0E.description:
Identify and categorize different
kinds of streams.

F812C3A5FD5248D78F9DCE8A656E84E3.description:
Demonstrate natural resource protection, maintenance, enhancement and
improvement techniques.

3AC137B2EF8B4B0FB1B8DC062151B921.description:
Demonstrate responsible management procedures and techniques to
protect, maintain, enhance, and improve natural resources.

B7BA9F41AACA447FA6C09E32DB4AA73A.description:
Use GIS data for a given area
to devise a management plan for the management,
conservation, improvement, and
enhancement of its natural resources.

A1DB87B1EE9042D3A91545189BF5C1C2.description:
Analyze an areaâs resources
using GIS technologies.

8739859A4A8745B9B11E7CB0988F09DF.description:
Summarize how GIS can be
used to manage, conserve, improve and enhance
the natural resources of an area.

D9AFF505EC1B47B28276698D87E353BB.description:
Evaluate the availability of
and threats to natural resources using cartographic
skills, tools, and technologies (e.g.,
spread of invasive species, movement of
wildlife populations, changes to biodiversity
of edge of habitat versus interior, etc.).

30927093EB9F49FF8C44FC419856F35F.description:
Apply cartographic skills
and tools and technologies (e.g., land surveys,
geographic coordinate systems, etc.) to
locate natural resources.

C0AAD193B1C745D5ACEFA4057D4E8895.description:
Summarize how to use maps
and technologies to identify directions and
land features, calculate actual distance and
determine the elevations of points.

56EBB6BCA41C4749B5F011ADE777FB51.description:
Demonstrate cartographic skills, tools and technologies to aid in developing,
implementing and evaluating natural resource management plans.

E936178934414A2ABA9F48126951590C.description:
Develop recommendations
for the sustainable harvest of aquatic species.

63BF193E948B494DB1020105200EE9F4.description:
Analyze and apply techniques
used to acquire aquatic species for
their environmental, economic and social
sustainability.

369A8CEA037B480A8809F00C68F5817F.description:
Categorize aquatic species
used for commercial and recreational purposes.

AED9AC433F6F493993F70C9E1E69EECB.description:
Evaluate an example of outdoor
recreation and develop suggestions for
how that activity can be made more sustainable
in a manner that is acceptable to those
who take part in that activity.Â

9D2070572D304E6580184BCBBE0E63F8.description:
Assess different options for
improving the sustainability of outdoor recreation
based on its impact on natural resources
and likelihood of acceptance.

A857890F3F5342CFAE546B3E19C7A1B3.description:
Research and summarize
how recreational uses of natural resources
can be changed to improve sustainability.

6536047AB00041FBAB361651A998075F.description:
Assess trends in energy production
and consumption in order to predict
how the impact of alternative energy will
change in the future.

E73A9A6FE862451EB751497E9A93FDE5.description:
Assess and evaluate factors
that affect the economic, environmental and
social sustainability in regards to the use of
alternative sources of energy.

580B824C231E478785F2931920BF14CA.description:
Compare and contrast the
costs and benefits (e.g., environmental impacts,
etc.) of alternative sources of energy
(e.g., hydroelectric, solar, wind, biofuels, geothermal,
etc.).

30263811951F42298A7EFB7D582706EF.description:
Evaluate methods used to
extract and process shale oil for economic,
environmental and social sustainability.

B87513B49E0A4468866C24D40D3362AB.description:
Assess the economic impact
of shale oil extraction (i.e., fracking) in
regards to the costs and benefits

A4AC44AD428F4CE4B06F54C7C8811EF6.description:
Compare and contrast
the costs and benefits (e.g., environmental
impacts, etc.) of shale oil from fracking to a
local, state and/or national economy.

529495694F2B4F66A916F62B76AE54DA.description:
Evaluate methods used to
extract and process fossil fuels for economic,
environmental and social sustainability.

52045BEF4DFF48D5925E9BF59C12A991.description:
Assess the economic impact
of fossil fuel extraction in regards to the costs
and benefits to a local, state and/or national
economy.

7C239922CD114A159BA9F362F0F54C12.description:
Compare and contrast the
costs and benefits (e.g., impacts on environment,
economic, wildlife, etc.) of fossil fuels
to a local, state and/or national economy.

9043DACADA9A4147A5FF65DF5EAF679E.description:
Evaluate methods used to
extract and process minerals for economic,
environmental and social sustainability.

EFF2F504BB99429A90C19BA4A45E093D.description:
Assess the economic impact
of mineral extraction in regards to the costs
and benefits to a local, state and/or national
economy.

437EEBA93986403FA9049C33D395518A.description:
Compare and contrast the
costs and benefits (e.g., impacts on environment,
economic, wildlife, etc.) of mineral
extraction to a local, state and/or national
economy.

9FD0D9FB38E14E06B6071751BA2B5AA3.description:
Develop a method for the
sustainable harvest of wildlife species.

85AF47124FFA4AB9A3BD59F806562567.description:
Assess and apply techniques
used to harvest wildlife in regards to
sustainability, practicality and other factors.

7D064AA8CA2B4091AF1C754A509648B8.description:
Research and describe
methods by which wildlife can be sustainably
harvested (e.g., controlled harvests, hunting
licenses, regulations, etc.).

3F16A9E52B4746508C14A9CC125D54EF.description:
Develop a forest harvesting
plan that ensures economic, environmental
and social sustainability.

A9B761F7E66C4B36A91F20A3B190810D.description:
Assess harvesting methods in
regards to their economic value, environmental
impact, and other factors.

52888827E5144FCBA39C5C65818AD207.description:
Sustainably produce, harvest, process and use natural resource products (e.g.,
forest products, wildlife, minerals, fossil fuels, shale oil, alternative energy, recreation, aquatic
species, etc.).

355618376F5043DE9CE93F9CF2D881E9.description:
Develop plans to ensure sustainable production and processing of
natural resources.

D477BF5535DF46A5AC8F5DD1F8BB904E.description:
Create a communication
plan to influence the behavior of people, call
people to action and instill a sense of civic
behavior related to the conservation, management,
enhancement and improvement of
natural resources.

1C7BBDA0BD4C41029F55ABED115A7135.description:
Â Analyze and summarize
examples of how communication can be used
to influence behavior, call people to action
and instill a sense of civic behavior related to
the conservation, management, enhancement
and improvement of natural resources.

89F3C43582FF444C946C70F5EE664865.description:
Examine and describe how
communication can be used to influence behavior,
call people to action and instill a sense
of civic behavior related to the conservation,
management, enhancement and improvement
of natural resources.

887D0802F87742BD975076AE4FDF3304.description:
Anticipate and predict how
messages about the conservation, management,
enhancement and improvement of natural
resources will change because of social
media and the Internet.

D53431E5C1724DABB7133233C88BB153.description:
Assess how to most effectively
communicate a message about the
conservation, management, enhancement
and improvement of natural resources via
social media and the Internet.

D6F6362C564D4B57B6334383B26CB4BD.description:
Research and summarize
how social media and the Internet have
changed how people perceive and utilize
natural resources (e.g., greater awareness of
conservation issues, calls to action, etc.).

CB0B7A88F1354F3A8452C4ADD5E99219.description:
Devise and implement a
strategy for communicating a natural resources
message through media.

C9DA584514744F98BECA5E98F7971229.description:
Assess the effectiveness of
different methods for communicating natural
resource messages.

C9E8C7D1D5B444A39B19B115265BBA56.description:
Examine and describe ways
in which a message regarding natural resources
may be communicated to the public
through standard media sources (e.g., press,
radio, TV, public appearances, etc.).

15F3B10810394886971E5DC14B75E101.description:
Communicate information to the public regarding topics related to the
management, protection, enhancement, and improvement of natural resources.

BC2A02666FB840BDB707DB8D1D4861B7.description:
Anticipate and predict the
economic impact green technology and alternative
energy.

96EAB591D8494DFBA4728EE272848CAE.description:
Analyze and document how
the adoption of green technology and/or
alternative energy affected a local, state or
national economy.

DD31939C1DA7424CAFA5ECBA0D0D08C3.description:
Compare and contrast the
economic impact of green technology and
alternative energy.

CDFB6B50694E4B02A8A632ACC9B6186F.description:
Anticipate and predict how
changes to the availability of natural resources
because of human activity may impact a
local, state and national economy.

35F066190EF34220BEB264D2CB5E7E27.description:
Assess the importance of
the use of natural resources on local, state
and national economies.

3AF40180A3B449509981AB6FC1D97865.description:
Research the impact of the
use of natural resources on local, state and
national economies (e.g., outdoor recreation,
energy production, preservation, etc.).

68B7F791ADF149BEBB1F9F5FA8BF438A.description:
Devise a plan to improve the
conservation, protection, improvement and
enhancement of natural resources based on
economic value and practices.

734005A7D91544A28A0C05B9AF09019F.description:
Assess whether economic
value increases or decreases the conservation,
protection, improvement and enhancement
of natural resources.

3A2582172D8443688AAC885D1120609E.description:
Compare and contrast how
the economic value of a natural resource
affects its availability

3D8C0D115B314E91A8FB5D2DFC1647DC.description: Examine and explain how economics affects the use of natural resources.

E1E9EFA40C2449309E2298CC271487A3.description:
Anticipate and predict how
future technological advancements may affect
the use and views of natural resources.

10DEF1E11F86436A95E4EEA2687843AA.description:
Analyze and document how
some technological advancements changed
how natural resources were used and viewed
(e.g., Industrial Revolution, fossil fuels, green
technology, etc.).

77C175E8452D41ECA41FEA95D715AE8F.description:
Research how technology
has affected the use and views of natural
resources.

F67DC0D07F844E46801815A90EE1A199.description:
Anticipate and predict how
societyâs views and use of natural resources
will continue to change as a result of historical
figures and trends in modern society

24DA6059910A499283DC92B6B54A5642.description:
Examine and describe the
relationship between current trends in natural
resource systems and historical figures that
played a prominent role in shaping how natural
resources are viewed and used today

D8886B6894D2467CA234554C34CEA0D2.description:
Research and assess how
historical figures played a prominent role in
shaping how natural resources are viewed
and used today (e.g., Aldo Leopold, Teddy
Roosevelt, John Muir, Rachel Carson, Gaylord
Nelson, etc.).

401D60D422A44E7B8131A67E91E2C53B.description:
Develop predictions for how
the management, protection, enhancement
and improvement of natural resources will
evolve through social considerations (e.g., establishment
of national parks, public opinion,
and fishing, reduction of waste and energy
consumption, etc.).

38140AE587834D5A8F562B91D23883C6.description:
Analyze how social considerations
can affect the use and sustainability of
natural resources.

91B80A1CDBD04DC2965937D665D6DC11.description:
Summarize and categorize
the different social considerations in regards
to the use of natural resources (e.g., public
versus private, laws and regulations, economics,
green technology, etc.).

C74F800AE6894C8FB5A44AF6FE825B39.description:
Analyze how modern perceptions of natural resource management, protection,
enhancement and improvement change and develop over time.

32C6942D01544F2794A11B3BEF721A9E.description:
Devise a strategy for preventing
the loss of species and biodiversity
that takes into account the primary causes of
species extinction from human activity.

2EFC3F4F5C66461F9BE908AEEA7C8764.description:
Assess causes of extinction
and describe how those causes related to loss
of biodiversity.Â

3B4A7FC98D894D57996DD4C139AF41E3.description:
Categorize the primary
causes of extinction of living species due to
human activity (e.g., over-harvesting, habitat
loss, invasive species, pollution, etc.).

385FA25CD5CF456BB5EB81D8B6D2B5B9.description:
Evaluate how the availability
of natural resources can be improved through
changes to human activity.Â

2D05218848614C59941BD056D3106334.description:
Assess and explain how
different kinds of human activity affect the
use and availability of natural resources (i.e.,
agriculture, industry, transportation, etc.).

BF82D439E5B844E49DE41C5B437EA612.description:
Summarize the relationship
between natural resources, ecosystems and
human activity

71862FBC630B4FEB90132A9AFB626938.description: Assess the impact of human activities on the availability of natural resources.Â

F75AF368D0AD40A8B8C8B6836AFC4AD8.description:
Evaluate the impact and
effectiveness of agencies associated with
natural resources systems (e.g., regulation
of consumption, prevention of damage to
natural resources systems, management of
ecological interactions, etc.).

4E8962457FB54820A169733481066F7B.description:
Analyze the specific purpose
of agencies associated with natural resources
systems.

3A73ED84881A46D781A20FAF7446CEB1.description:
Distinguish between the
types of agencies associated with natural
resources systems.

EBA8FC2F478242D194CE3722B90132A2.description:
Evaluate the impact of laws
associated with natural resources systems
(e.g., mitigation, water regulations, carbon
emissions, game limits, invasive species, etc.).

722D0A86CC784133B40BBC8303A80A58.description:
Analyze the structure of laws
associated with natural resources systems.

3C64046B17684AAB89DA9107F194CCFB.description:
Distinguish between the
types of laws associated with natural resources
systems.

CAE59245AED44A4CA3C2FCDA16859F22.description:
Examine and interpret the purpose, enforcement, impact and effectiveness of
laws and agencies related to natural resource management, protection, enhancement and
improvement (e.g., water regulations, game laws, historic preservation laws, environmental
policy, etc.).

DF7F45A99A364821A8B26D9EA248E894.description: Analyze the interrelationships between natural resources and humans.

FF53EB02A1004DE185488A8B8090FB73.description:
Evaluate the presence and
impact of invasive species on natural resources
in a given area and devise a plan to
prevent, control or eliminate invasive species
from that habitat.Â

AE1DC2F2E3EC46E4B73AFA0E00FC0FA9.description:
Analyze factors that influence
the establishment and spread of invasive
species and determine the appropriate
steps to prevent or minimize the impact of
invasive species.

1A8E19A9B7AE49F1AAAD56491FBBFBBA.description:
Research and summarize
examples of invasive species.

E243C5BDC1B54FC2812E0178F528787E.description:
Create a management plan
for a population of a species in an ecosystem
given its population ecology, population
density and population dispersion in natural
resource systems.

A700D346FFF34A3180B7084B7256AFBF.description:
Analyze the factors that
influence population density and population
dispersion in natural resource systems.

C1E46405A0A94DA8889E109432EB522F.description:
Differentiate between population
ecology, population density and population
dispersion and describe the importance
of these concepts to natural resource systems.

6287E2ED6F674322B4E10D6E1CE17201.description:
Apply ecological concepts and principles to living organisms in natural resource
systems.

BA347E43B8AC411085BAE8F2670EA639.description:
Devise a soil management
plan to minimize erosion and maximize biodiversity,
plant productivity, and the formation
of topsoil.

11072EA0E9904493B1798BC41546797F.description:
Analyze a plot of land in
order to determine which soil management
techniques would be most applicable.

B9C212159E164393BC18F02F3D678601.description:
Compare and contrast techniques
associated with soil management (e.g.,
soil survey and interpretation, erosion control,
etc.).

EB454A77D7E9418195E0C5052847325A.description:
Devise a forest management
plan that improves the habitat while sustainably
maximizing the amount of timber that
can be harvested.

406B08C2DF3149ECBBF25C3589CB3EA3.description:
Analyze a forest in order to
determine which forestry techniques would
improve that habitat.

14EE72A37CB94E8780F7C55119D47B67.description:
Compare and contrast techniques
associated with sustainable forestry
(e.g., timber stand improvement, diversity
improvement, reforestation, etc.).

E2A9804FE6BF4B07A48F3733A1D41FBF.description:
Interpret signs of habitat
disturbances and resilience in an ecosystem
and use these signs to assess the health of an
ecosystem.

BD667CD7DD134200B628DC9E9C2E4F52.description:
Analyze and summarize
examples of habitat disturbances and habitat
resilience.

421621F66B80474F99D2028481D47930.description:
Compare and contrast the
impact of habitat disturbances and habitat
resilience.

7B5F96A1181F44659798FF6DCA7E7E7D.description:
Evaluate the stages of succession
present in an ecosystem and predict
which species will become more prevalent
through future stages of succession.

FCA26B25C5B4437DB2F88899909A02F8.description:
Analyze and summarize examples
of stages of succession.

C77D6F75C9614798B3135780811E9D7E.description:
Research and describe the
stages of ecological succession.

DA54DBFDAADA4E13973FA74BCE8581DB.description: Apply ecological concepts and principles to terrestrial natural resource systems.

C2FDBE07316C483AB6378AD92ECAE6F3.description:
Devise and apply strategies
for the creation, enhancement and management
of riparian zones and riparian buffers.

8565E74D1B9F4FB6B6BF38D9981EB8BE.description:
Assess techniques used in
the creation, enhancement and management
of riparian zones and riparian buffers.

2D49A25450544558AF51D29049461FC0.description:
Compare and contrast riparian
zones and riparian buffers based on their
function.

20FFFBD97233411CBF84E7803EA837C2.description:
Devise and apply strategies
to manage, protect, enhance or improve
sources of groundwater or surface water
based on its properties.

E775B7124C1543E786A4A69859852B72.description:
Analyze how different classifications
of ground and surface water affect
ecosystem function.

D85385C958494E5B8A8CAA243E24DFC2.description:
Examine and describe the
importance of groundwater and surface water
to natural resources.

71AE6B1C1AD740ACB1F2A48426DABA95.description:
Evaluate and defend the
importance of watersheds to ecosystem
function.

3A82833F8993455FABB953C7DE9C3767.description:
Assess the function of watersheds
and their effect on natural resources.

7E0833B598254682BD247FEE683A7354.description:
Summarize the roles and
properties of watersheds.

CCA7F06D0F9F487C845E75AA36DF2295.description: Apply ecological concepts and principles to aquatic natural resource systems.

319241D80BF346A9BC5CFAD64C215B79.description:
Assess the primary causes of
climate change and design strategies to lessen
its impact on natural resource systems.

937DAFCEC70740C993F6B9B7861EE858.description:
Analyze the impact that
climate has on natural resources and debate
how this impact has changed due to human
activity.

D68163A7025B44E6B8975AFECB645D28.description:
Research and summarize
how climate factors influence natural resource
systems.

B9517EE916ED4247B57165D253EA8B75.description:
Evaluate and make recommendations
to lessen the impact of human
activity on the ability of the atmosphere to
regulate biogeochemical cycles.

D19BDE1F538C426E8D58E7C439FFC5EC.description:
Assess the role that the
atmosphere plays in the regulation of biogeochemical
cycles.

9D26FB2DF3D045319F39FFCB6DBE7222.description:
Classify different kinds of
biogeochemical cycles and the role they play
in natural resources systems.

20C2A8C1B7144A488C6F32F23FC509CE.description: Apply ecological concepts and principles to atmospheric natural resource systems.

56D7D166972B44AFA01421D5B1142BAA.description:
Conduct an assessment of
the resource inventories or population in a
given area.

40CF4A53B24F4695804AFC94EF151459.description:
Apply procedures for conducting
resource inventories and population
studies.

867E6C7978A7408BA54A8F170F777C2F.description:
Research the purpose and
value of resource inventories and population
studies.

5828AB252C534AD9AC0FC44C624B0377.description:
Evaluate the non-living resources
present in an area to determine the
best practices for improving, enhancing and
protecting an ecosystem.Â

166167E7303344BAB1D246145F5D89A8.description:
Apply identification techniques
to determine the types of non-living
resources in an area.Â

9E6283764D77469B8244E4BE52914382.description:
Research and examine the
characteristics used to identify non-living
resources (e.g., soil types, climate, geography,
etc.).

E078B077BA574BABB7CAFFEE675E37AC.description:
Evaluate the aquatic species
present to assess the health of an ecosystem.

317EABCE3A4A4474AF08550A76C0A157.description:
Apply identification techniques
to determine the species of an aquatic
organism.

E601339DD3334F4C9DF986778A0AD0A9.description:
Research and examine the
characteristics used to identify aquatic species.

7EC3FD48DB1640849484B80D9ECAAFD1.description:
Evaluate the species of wildlife
and insects present to assess the health of
an ecosystem.

5DCCF696DBC84B02964E644E4F4708DB.description:
Apply identification techniques
to determine the species of wildlife or
insect.

BB4F87FD1D6E4B6F8710BA9E301A8E64.description:
Research and examine the
characteristics used to identify wildlife and
insects.

1C0D572670744A5E98AACBCBB27A3288.description:
Evaluate the species of herbaceous
plants present to assess the health
of an ecosystem (e.g., presence of native
versus invasive plants, biodiversity, etc.).

25A23EF6D85846B483F20935F391F73B.description:
Apply identification techniques
to determine the species of an herbaceous
plant.

8F7915D42FAE409A9CF4317E60E66983.description:
Research and examine the
characteristics used to identify herbaceous
plants.

B0C4393D198642AA9DEBED5AE7F829A8.description:
Evaluate the species of trees
present to assess the health of an ecosystem
(e.g., presence of native versus invasive species,
biodiversity, etc.).

1E8684A9BB4541D6A5B32BE5A66B7E11.description:
Apply identification techniques
to determine the species of a tree or
woody plant.

48ADF43F452F4F62900F7ED6A8614637.description:
Research and examine the
characteristics used to identify trees and
woody plants.

15B50690EC7E4DD9BB2F593090F02AEA.description:
Classify different types of natural resources in order to enable protection,
conservation, enhancement and management in a particular geographical region.

30C1C6DF588F48828E2A67612E29FF29.description:
Evaluate biodiversity in ecosystems
and devise strategies to enhance the
function of an ecosystem and the availability
of natural resources by increasing the level of
biodiversity.

A6089E344DAA4F60923104D51A985BC4.description:
Analyze how biodiversity
develops through evolution, natural selection
and adaptation; explain the importance of
biodiversity to ecosystem function and availability
of natural resources.

F6FAE1EAF299406C9520D4141F2C6DFF.description:
Summarize and classify
different kinds of living species based on
evolutionary traits.

82C2300443B94D6590B3D9D1DBBD3622.description:
Conduct analyses of ecosystems
and document the interactions of living
species and non-living resources.

6BAD834C8CE04D0F9B21AC870E8D01BC.description:
Analyze the interdependence
of organisms within an ecosystem (e.g., food
webs, niches, impact of keystone species,
etc.) and assess the dependence of organisms
on nonliving components (climate, geography,
energy flow, nutrient cycling, etc.).

88FA9C9BD5C54E2ABAF5E40BD497E176.description:
Summarize the components
that comprise all ecosystems.Â

2ABCD3E0C01240018FEF7A103AEC348D.description:
Devise strategies for the preservation
of natural resources based on their
classification.

259222E07AB546EB8CEA4B8B2C265999.description:
Assess the characteristics of
a natural resource to determine its classification.

DD285E0EA60646BF808C3A0F574140EE.description:
Summarize and classify the
different kinds of natural resources using
common classification schemes (e.g., living
versus non-living, renewable versus nonrenewable,
native versus introduced, etc.).Â

029E8ED065E0416CB70A705703FDD310.description:
Apply methods of classification to examine natural resource availability and
ecosystem function in a particular region.Â

E521933EAEBC413088F1898CD4577D65.description:
Plan and conduct natural resource management activities that apply
logical, reasoned and scientifically based solutions to natural resource issues and
goals.
